stimulusHtml: The changes in world carbon dioxide emissions and the world forested area reflect which of the following twentieth century historical contexts?

features.html:
ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGE IN THE TWENTIETH CENTURY

Item Percent Increase, 1890s–1990s Percent Decrease, 1890s–1990s
1. World economy (World GDP) 1,400%
2. World industrial output 4,000%
3. World energy use 1,300%
4. World carbon dioxide emissions 1,700%
5. World water use 900%
6. World marine fish catch 3,500%
7. World area under agricultural cultivation 2%
8. World number of bird and mammal species 1%
9. World forested area 20%
Source: Based on J.R. McNeill, Something New Under the Sun: An Environmental History of the Twentieth-Century World, (New York: W.W. Norton & Co., 2000), Table 12.1, p. 360.

choicesHtml: The increase in economic liberalization and free-market economic policies
The increase in agricultural productivity and global population numbers
The emergence of debates about the nature of and causes of climate change
The emergence of global movements protesting social inequalities
